document.title: South Dakota Social Studies Standards Adopted April 17, 2023

F1407A31722940C397CE2D429BCC1119.description:
The student can identify elements that make up a person’s culture, including political culture.
CG

37DE07400DF84E3DA42983177049D872.description:
The student can explain how geographic location and features contributed to the
development and form of historical civilizations and how they influenced the actions of people
in a given historical event. HG

3477BF5B4BBE46F69158DA8E3BFCC8EC.description:
Students will recognize and explain the differences and similarities within and between cultures
and people groups in the world’s places and regions.

F1D1248199F245B2BDAD4D0E6898B92F.description:
Major Countries (Cities): Argentina (Buenos Aires), Belize, Bolivia, Brazil (Sao Paulo,
Rio de Janeiro), Chile (Santiago), Colombia, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru (Lima), Uruguay,
Venezuela, United States (New York City, Los Angeles, Chicago, Houston), Canada
(Ottawa, Toronto, Montreal), Mexico (Mexico City), Greenland, Jamaica, Dominican
Republic, Cuba (Havana), Panama, Costa Rica, Haiti, Guatemala (Guatemala City),
Honduras, Barbados, The Bahamas, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Cayman Islands, Grenada

F0ADD0A4522C4A43AE85B9E01EF67AF1.description:
Major Geographic Features: Atlantic Ocean, Pacific Ocean, Amazon River, Amazon
Rainforest, Andes Mountains, Cape Horn, Panama Canal, Yucatan Peninsula, Baja
California Peninsula, Straits of Magellan, Isthmus of Panama, Rocky Mountains,
Appalachian Mountains, Mississippi River, Missouri River, Ohio River, Columbia River,
Colorado River, Grand Canyon, Hudson Bay, Saint Lawrence River, Great Lakes, Great
Salt Lake, Gulf of Mexico, Rio Grande, Yukon River, Mount McKinley, Mojave Desert,
Chihuahua Desert, Sonoran Desert, Atacama Desert, Great Plains

801B0FB7815F4096AA3392B9048825F1.description:
Countries (Major Cities): Albania, Austria (Vienna), Belarus, Belgium (Brussels), BosniaHerzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark (Copenhagen),
Estonia, Finland (Helsinki), France (Paris, Marseilles), Germany (Berlin, Cologne),
Gibraltar, Greece (Athens), Hungary, Iceland, Ireland (Dublin), Italy (Rome, Milan,
Venice), Kosovo, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Macedonia, Malta, Moldova,
Montenegro, Netherlands (Amsterdam), Norway, Poland (Warsaw, Gdansk, Krakow),
Portugal (Lisbon), Romania, Russia (Moscow, St. Petersburg), San Marino, Serbia,
Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain (Madrid), Sweden, Switzerland (Geneva), Ukraine (Kiev),
United Kingdom (London, Oxford, Edinburgh), England, Scotland, Wales, Northern
Ireland, Vatican City

9A9244B2E7F647D4A1AEAF37A2DF516A.description:
Major Geographic Features: Atlantic Ocean, Arctic Ocean, Baltic Sea, Volga River,
Danube River, Ural Mountains, Rhine River, Elbe River, Seine River, Po River, Thames
River, Carpathian Mountains, Alps Mountains, Apennine Mountains, Pyrenees
Mountains, Iberian Peninsula, Scandinavia, Balkans, Irish Sea, Bay of Biscay, English
Channel, Mediterranean Sea, Peloponnesus, Dardanelle Straits, Black Sea, North Sea,
Normandy, Mount Blanc, Rhineland, Polish Plain, Caucuses

EA76ED3DA4364859A0E569999CCFE251.description:
Major Countries (Cities): China (Chongqing, Shanghai, Beijing, Wuhan, Hong Kong),
Japan (Tokyo), Mongolia, North Korea (Pyongyang), Russia (Vladivostok), South Korea
(Seoul), Taiwan

B420EAA81ADB4248B1D243C9B5925791.description:
Major Geographic Features: Pacific Ocean, Arctic Ocean, Sea of Japan, Yellow Sea, East
China Sea, Gobi Desert, Ob River, Himalayan Mountains, Yellow River, Yangtze River,
Siberia, Kolyma River, Golden Horn Bay, Korean Peninsula, Mount Everest

AD353EE097224D3D93037F38AF971756.description:
Major Countries (Cities): Australia, Cambodia, Indonesia (Jakarta), Laos, Malaysia,
Myanmar (Mandalay), New Zealand, Philippines (Manila), Singapore, Thailand,
Vietnam (Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi)

FE576A64DDDE4CC2979FDDFE945EF5B9.description:
Major Geographic Features: Indian Ocean, Australia, New Zealand, Antarctica, major
Pacific islands, Pacific Ocean, Coral Sea, Bay of Bengal, South China Sea, Strait of
Malacca, Great Victoria Desert, Great Barrier Reef, Australasia rainforest, Indo-Burma
Rainforest

AC7674B5473946149122235B1E6ACE2D.description:
Major Countries (Cities): Afghanistan (Kabul), Bangladesh, India (Mumbai, Delhi,
Bangalore, Kolkata), Kazakhstan (Almaty), Nepal, Pakistan (Islamabad), Sri Lanka,
Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan

DEB3EEF6C0434057B4903C64BACF6E03.description:
Major Geographic Features: Indian Ocean, Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, Ganges River,
Indo-Gangetic Plain, Northern Mountains, Deccan Plateau, Himalayan Mountains, the
Steppes, Indus River

6CF95E767703433983707B3D2D564763.description:
Major Countries (Cities): Armenia, Azerbaijan, Cyprus, Georgia, Iran (Tehran), Iraq
(Baghdad, Mosul), Israel (Jerusalem, Tel Aviv), Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon (Beruit),
Qatar, Saudi Arabia (Riyadh, Mecca), Syria (Damascus), Turkey (Istanbul, Ankara),
United Arab Emirates (Dubai), Yemen

1EC12A7FE46B4F2D9A3F8C54CC983715.description:
Major Geographic Features: Black Sea, Mediterranean Sea, Caspian Sea, Red Sea,
Indian Ocean, Arabian Peninsula, Persian Gulf, Euphrates River, Tigris River, Sea of
Galilee, Jordan River, Strait of Hormuz, Gulf of Oman

349D980589084FBFA88550A141AB1B4C.description:
Major Countries (Cities): Algeria (Algiers), Angola, Botswana, Cameroon, Central
African Republic, Chad, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of the Congo (Kinshasa),
Djibouti, Egypt (Cairo, Giza), Equatorial Guinea, Ethiopia, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea,
Kenya (Nairobi), Liberia, Libya (Tripoli), Madagascar, Mali, Morocco (Tangier,
Casablanca), Mozambique, Namibia, Niger, Nigeria (Lagos), Rwanda, Senegal, Sierra
Leone, Somalia, South Africa (Johannesburg, Cape Town, Pretoria), South Sudan,
Sudan, Swaziland, Tanzania, Tunisia (Tunis), Uganda, Zambia, Zimbabwe

8D4B7EE13EAA40A1A6BA80B07889605C.description:
Major Geographic Features: Mediterranean Sea, Atlantic Ocean, Indian Ocean, Sahara
Desert, Nile River, Lake Victoria, Mount Kilimanjaro, Atlas Mountains, the Horn of
Africa, Red Sea, Suez Canal, Cape of Good Hope, Niger River, Congo River, Kalahari
Desert, Congo Rainforest

53FC06A684C34199BA33B0D16F852481.description:
The student can use the six essential elements of geography to describe the following regions
in A thru F subpoints below. The six essential elements of geography are spatial terms, places
and regions, physical systems, human systems, environment and society, and the uses of
geography. G

075BAD257B6948FB8E128BB5DD6B8C4C.description:
The student will construct a map or other geographic representations that demonstrate the
physical and cultural characteristics. G

D9FE1210CA1048DEA32405DB4473E9AA.description:
Students will demonstrate knowledge of applying geospatial resources and tools to interpret and
analyze geographic information.
